project.name: RGBDSLAM - 6DOF SLAM for Kinect-style cameras
project.briefdescription: RGBDSLAM allows to quickly acquire colored 3D models of objects and indoor scenes with a hand-held Kinect-style camera. It provides a SLAM front-end based on visual features s.a. SURF or SIFT to match pairs of acquired images, and uses RANSAC to robustly estimate the 3D transformation between them. The resulting camera pose graph is then optimized with the SLAM back-end HOG-Man.
project.description: RGBDSLAM allows to quickly acquire colored 3D models of objects and indoor scenes with a hand-held Kinect-style camera. It uses visual features s.a. SURF or SIFT to match pairs of acquired images, and uses RANSAC to robustly estimate the 3D transformation between them. To achieve online processing, the current image is matched only versus a subset of the previous images. Subsequently, it constructs a graph whose nodes correspond to camera views and whose edges correspond to the estimated 3D transformations. The graph is then optimized with HOG-Man to reduce the accumulated pose errors. Further information and installation instructions can be found in the README file and at
project.requirement: Developed and tested under Ubuntu (GCC). Requires ROS Diamondback and HOG-Man.
project.map: Pose graph with colored point clouds
project.input: Monochrome and depth image, colored point cloud
